meanings.definition: Overmines (verb): to excavate or dig beneath a mine
meanings.sent1: The miners carefully overmined the area to extract valuable minerals.
meanings.sent2: Miners often overmine to reach deeper layers of ore.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to overmine the backyard, thinking it was a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her determination overmined any obstacles in her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The relentless rain overmines the soil, causing it to erode away.

meanings.definition: Overmines (noun): underground tunnels or passages beneath a mine
meanings.sent1: Exploring the overmines was an exciting adventure for the group.
meanings.sent2: The overmines provided a secret passage for the rebels to escape.
meanings.sent3: The overmines were so dark and mysterious that they felt like a hidden world.
meanings.sent4: The overmines echoed with the sounds of distant machinery.
meanings.sent5: The overmines were a labyrinth of interconnected tunnels.

meanings.definition: Overmines (adjective): located or occurring beneath a mine
meanings.sent1: The overmines chamber was cool and damp compared to the surface.
meanings.sent2: Miners descended into the overmines to continue their work underground.
meanings.sent3: The overmines level of the mine was off-limits to visitors for safety reasons.
meanings.sent4: The overmines area was prone to flooding during heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The overmines section of the mine held hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
